document.title: iteRates: An R Package for Implementing a Parametric Rate Comparison on Phylogenetic Trees
document.abstract: Patterns of diversification rate variation detected in phylogenetic hypotheses are frequently used to infer historical, ecological, and evolutionary processes. The parametric rate comparison (PRC) is a method for detecting rate variation in trees that models branch lengths as random variables drawn from familiar statistical distributions. iteRates is a library of functions for the R statistical computing environment for implementing PRC on phylogenetic trees. Here, we describe some of the functions in iteRates for subtree identification, tree manipulation, applying the PRC and K-clades PRC analyses, and conducting a whole-tree randomization test.
document.publication-title: Faculty Publications and Other Works -- Ecology and Evolutionary Biology
